plugins.name: Quick styles
plugins.description:
How does the plugin works:


Save a Style

1.Open the plugin library.

2.Select the layer you want to save styles from.

3.Click Save on one of the style slots in the plugin.

4.The style is saved!


Set a Shortcut

1.Open System Settings.

2.Navigate to Keyboard > Keyboard Shortcuts > App Shortcuts.

3.Click on the plus (+) icon.

4.Set the app to Figma in the menu.

5.Type the exact menu title name.

6.Set your shortcut and click Done!


Apply a Style

1.Select any layer.

2.Use the menu item or shortcut to apply styles!
plugins.tagline: Save properties of a layer and quickly apply them from the menu or using a shortcut.

plugins.name: Frame Flow
plugins.description:
The Figma plugin “Frame Flow” allows you to duplicate the selected frame to the right or below with a predefined spacing. In addition to duplication, it also lets you insert blank frames at custom intervals. It’s especially useful when creating presentation documents, as it helps you add pages smoothly without disrupting the layout spacing. Setting up keyboard shortcuts is highly recommended for efficient use.


New Frame

Creates a new empty frame with the specified size.


Add Frame Right

Creates a new empty frame with the specified size to the right of the currently selected frame.

Recommended shortcut: ⌘ + ⌥ (Option) + → (Right Arrow)


Add Frame Below

Creates a new empty frame with the specified size below the currently selected frame.

Recommended shortcut: ⌘ + ⌥ (Option) + ↓ (Down Arrow)


Duplicate Frame Right

Duplicates the currently selected frame to the right.

Recommended shortcut: ⌘ + ⌥ (Option) + ⇧ (Shift) + → (Right Arrow)


Duplicate Frame Below

Duplicates the currently selected frame below.

Recommended shortcut: ⌘ + ⌥ (Option) + ⇧ (Shift) + ↓ (Down Arrow)


Settings

Configure various parameters.




Figmaプラグイン「Frame Flow」は、選択中のフレームを、事前に設定した間隔で右隣や下に複製できるプラグインです。複製のみではなく、白紙のフレームを好きな間隔で配置することも可能です。主に資料作成時、ページの間隔を崩さずスムーズにページを増やしていきたい時に活躍します。ショートカットを設定するのがおすすめです。


New Frame

設定したサイズの空フレームを新規作成します。


Add Frame Right

いま選択しているフレームの右隣に、設定したサイズの空フレームを新規作成します。おすすめショートカットキーは⌘ + ⌥(option) + →(右矢印)です。


Add Frame Below

いま選択しているフレームの下に、設定したサイズの空フレームを新規作成します。おすすめショートカットキーは⌘ + ⌥(option) + ↓(下矢印)です。


Duplicate Frame Right

いま選択しているフレームの右隣に、フレームを複製します。

おすすめショートカットキーは⌘ + ⌥(option) + ⇧(shift) + →(右矢印)です。


Duplicate Frame Below

いま選択しているフレームの下に、フレームを複製します。

おすすめショートカットキーは⌘ + ⌥(option) + ⇧(shift) + ↓(下矢印)です。


Settings

様々な値を設定します。
plugins.tagline: Quickly layout 1920x1080 frames

plugins.description:

🕵️‍♀️ Scans your entire document for matching colors—no hunting required!

🎯 Auto-applies styles to elements with exact color matches (magic, right?).

✨ Creates new styles for those sneaky color variants with different opacities.

📊 Gives you a summary of all the styles applied and new ones created—boom!

Ready to let the plugin do the heavy lifting? 😎

plugins.name: TextSwapper
plugins.description:
Features


Easily customize text for legal contracts, sales proposals, and resumes in Figma.

Quickly update text without needing extra tools.

Streamlined text replacement for multiple objects, components, and frames.

Simple and intuitive interface for seamless integration with your workflow.

Save time ⏰ and eliminate the hassle of manually editing text in Figma!

How:


Add the word "page" to the name of your page frame (e.g., agreement_page).

Enter the text you want to replace in the "Find text" field (e.g., {company name}).

Enter the new text in the "Replace with" field (e.g., Figma).

Use the "Update" button to replace the specified line, or the "Update All" button to replace all occurrences of the text in your document.

Use the + and - buttons to adjust the number of text fields.

Click Save to store your list of text replacements for faster updates when working on the same document.

Use Load to retrieve your saved list of text replacements and automatically fill in the fields. The current version retrieves only the latest saved list.

Click Download Selected Pages as PDF to download the selected pages as one merged PDF file.
plugins.tagline: Easily customize text for legal contracts, sales proposals, and resumes—no extra tools needed.

plugins.name: CopyCraft
plugins.description:
Streamline your text editing workflow with a powerful tool that helps you manage and edit text content across your Figma designs with precision and ease.

How it Works:


Text Loading:

Select any frame or text element in your Figma document and load it into the editor with a single click.


Smart Organization:

  1. Texts are automatically grouped by their parent elements (Frames, Components, or Groups)
  2. Each text element shows its character count and previous versions
  3. Intuitive interface for quick access to all text elements


Efficient Editing:

  1. Edit multiple text elements simultaneously
  2. Apply text styles directly from the editor
  3. Preview changes in real-time
  4. Navigate quickly to specific elements in your design


Key Features:

  1. Character counter for precise text control
  2. Previous version tracking for each text element
  3. Direct navigation to elements in your design
  4. Batch saving capabilities for groups of text
  5. Support for text styles application


Perfect for teams working on large-scale designs where maintaining text consistency and efficiency in editing is crucial.
plugins.tagline: Text Management Made Simple

plugins.name: md格式转设计稿 Markdown to Frame
plugins.description:
Introduction

This plugin allows users to convert Markdown text into fully structured Figma frames automatically, enhancing design workflows and documentation processes.


Function Description

The plugin parses Markdown syntax and creates corresponding Figma frames and text elements, supporting headings, lists, bold text, and horizontal rules. It ensures that all content is visually organized according to Markdown structuring.


Usage Method

Simply input your Markdown text into the provided text area in the plugin’s UI and click the ‘Convert Markdown’ button. The formatted content will appear as structured frames within your current Figma file.


Note

Ensure all text is properly formatted in Markdown before conversion. The frame width is fixed at 500px, but the height will adjust according to the content.


介绍

此插件允许用户将Markdown文本自动转换成完全结构化的Figma框架，增强设计工作流程和文档处理过程。


功能说明

插件解析Markdown语法，并创建相应的Figma框架和文本元素，支持标题、列表、加粗文本和水平规则。它确保所有内容都按照Markdown的结构进行视觉组织。


使用方法

只需在插件的用户界面中提供的文本区域中输入您的Markdown文本，然后点击“转换Markdown”按钮。格式化的内容将以结构化框架的形式出现在您当前的Figma文件中。


注意事项

确保在转换前所有文本都正确格式化为Markdown。框架宽度固定为500px，但高度将根据内容调整。

accepted.name: KingweiCheung
accepted.description: If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to contact me at kingweichueng@qq.com.

plugins.tagline: Transform Markdown into Structured Figma Frames

plugins.name: FrameFlex - Frame Resizer & Scaler
plugins.description:
🔹 FrameFlex – Smart Frame Resizing for Figma 🎯

Manually resizing frames can be a nightmare — especially when things break.

FrameFlex is a Figma plugin built to help you intelligently scale mobile frames, while preserving structure and layout integrity (when properly set up). ✨


Here’s what FrameFlex can do:


🔁 Multi-frame support – Resize multiple mobile frames in one action.

📱 Device presets – Quickly apply popular mobile screen sizes like iPhone, Android, and more.

📐 Layout-aware resizing – Maintains Auto Layout, constraints, and alignment — if your design is structured correctly.

🔤 Element scaling – Adjusts font size, spacing, strokes, and other properties proportionally.

🎯 Icon/vector protection – Prevents scaling on specific elements to avoid distortion.

⚙️ Rounding controls – Use smart, grid, or exact rounding for clean results.


💡 The more Auto Layout you use, the better the results will be.

FrameFlex works best when your design is clean, consistent, and fully built with Auto Layout in mind.


✅ Focused on mobile-first workflows.

⚠️ Support for other frame types depends on how well they're structured.
plugins.tagline: Resize multiple frames. Preserve structure. Stay consistent.

plugins.name: Remote Variable Replacer
plugins.description:
Sometimes Figma variables aren’t coming from inside the house. While this plugin has a likely very tiny amount of potential users, if I can help anybody save any time trying to locate and replace variables that are orphans or “remote”, then this has been worth it.


For whatever reason, variables in Figma can be attached to other libraries, older files, archived files even. This can cause major headaches when editing local variables and components don’t seem to respond to the edits.


I fully expect this plugin to have a limited lifespan as Figma themselves will likely improve variable handling during copy/pastes, schema renaming or other scenarios where variables can be orphaned.


In the meantime, I got you.
plugins.tagline: Replace those pesky remote variables!

Sometimes Figma variables aren’t coming from inside the house. While this plugin has a likely very tiny amount of potential users, if I can help anybody save any time trying to locate and replace variables that are orphans or “remote”, then this has been worth it.


For whatever reason, variables in Figma can be attached to other libraries, older files, archived files even. This can cause major headaches when editing local variables and components don’t seem to respond to the edits.


I fully expect this plugin to have a limited lifespan as Figma themselves will likely improve variable handling during copy/pastes, schema renaming or other scenarios where variables can be orphaned.


In the meantime, I got you.
135284.release_notes:
Improved the dropdowns for numerical variables to only show local variables whose base value match the remote variable base value. This should make the plugin easy to navigate if a user has hundreds of variables.

Removed beta language; Included network access for tailwind for easy stying and unpkg.com for React. This should fix the blank screen of death. Rookie mistake!

Also updated the data security details to let users know the network access is only for static items.

plugins.name: Find lost local — «Найти потерянные локальные компоненты»
plugins.description:
🔍 Find lost local automatically catches every local instance whose master component lives in another library / document.

Just set a prefix symbol (default “_”) and choose the search scope—current page or whole file.


Features

•Any nesting depth – detects instances hidden inside local components and their masters.

•Page-level grouping – shows how many problematic components each page contains.

•One-click jump – selects and zooms to the target instance.

•Custom prefix – works with _Tabs, .hidden, -draft, @deprecated, or any symbol you use for local components.


When it helps

•Before publishing a library – make sure no stray local copies remain in the file.

•During a design-system migration – quickly spot legacy components that still point elsewhere.

•While reviewing external files – instantly see what is pulled from external libraries.


How to use

1.Open the plugin and, if needed, change the prefix symbol.

2.Pick Current page or Whole file and click Search.

3.Review the grouped list. Clicking a component name jumps to its first found instance.

4.Items labelled “Outside pages” exist only inside master components; fix them in the corresponding library.


The plugin works entirely inside Figma—no internet access required, and no data ever leaves your account.


🔍 Find lost local автоматически вылавливает в вашем файле любые локальные инстансы, мастеры которых живут в другой библиотеке / документе.

Достаточно указать символ-префикс (по умолчанию — «_») и выбрать область поиска — текущую страницу или весь файл.


Возможности

  1. Любая глубина вложенности: находит инстансы, спрятанные внутри локальных компонентов и их мастеров.
  2. Группировка по страницам с подсчётом, сколько проблемных компонентов найдено на каждой.
  3. Переход одним кликом: выбирает и фокусирует нужный инстанс.
  4. Настраиваемый префикс: работает не только с «_Tabs», но и с «.hidden», «-draft», «@deprecated» — любым символом, который вы используете для локальных компонентов.


Когда пригодится

  1. Перед публикацией библиотеки — убедитесь, что в файле нет «висящих» локальных копий.
  2. Во время миграции компонентов из старой дизайн-системы в новую.
  3. При ревью сторонних файлов, чтобы сразу увидеть, что тянется из внешних библиотек.


Как пользоваться

  1. Откройте плагин и при необходимости поменяйте символ-префикс.
  2. Выберите Текущая страница или Весь файл и нажмите Поиск.
  3. Изучите сгруппированный список. Клик по названию компонента перенесёт вас к первому найденному инстансу.
  4. Компоненты, отмеченные как «Вне страницы», находятся только внутри мастеров — их можно исправить в контексте соответствующей библиотеки.


Плагин не требует интернет-доступа и не отправляет данные за пределы вашего аккаунта Figma.
plugins.tagline: Find all local component instances whose master lives in another file

plugins.description:
✨ Take control of your typography in Figma — instantly.


FontMaster scans your selected frames or artboards and lists every font used in your design. With an intuitive interface, you can preview and replace any or all fonts across your selection in just a few clicks. Whether you're managing design systems or updating brand fonts, FontMaster ensures consistency without the manual hassle.


🛠️ How to Use

  1. Run the plugin – FontMaster will automatically detect all fonts used in your selection.
  2. Browse detected fonts – View a list of all text styles and fonts present.
  3. Choose a new font – Pick a replacement font for each one or apply one font to all.
  4. Apply changes – Click “Apply” and FontMaster updates everything instantly.


✅ Why Use FontSwap?

plugins.name: Sustainalyzer
plugins.description:
Sustainalyzer helps you evaluate the ecological impact of your Figma designs. It detects design elements that conflict with the Web Sustainability Guidelines (WSG) and scientific research on digital sustainability.


The plugin checks for the following sustainability issues:


  1. Avoid videos, particularly autoplay or background media
  2. Minimize image use, especially large or excessive images
  3. Optimize images for size, format, and scaling
  4. Avoid third-party services (e.g. embeds, maps, social widgets)
  5. Avoid decorative elements that add visual weight without purpose
  6. Limit font variants to reduce font file size
  7. Prefer system fonts over custom fonts
  8. Reduce complexity by limiting the number of elements
  9. Disable animation autoplay to reduce processor load
  10. Consider older devices, avoiding effects that degrade performance or compatibility
  11. Use a design system to support reuse and reduce redundancy
  12. Choose energy-efficient colors, especially for large UI areas


Each guideline is tagged with an impact level—high, medium, or low—indicating its potential contribution to emissions. You can filter the results by impact level to focus on the most critical issues.


To use Sustainalyzer, simply select the elements you want to analyze and run the plugin.
plugins.tagline: Check your designs for sustainability issues based on the Web Sustainability Guidelines.

The plugin quickly scales selected images to 100% of their real screenshot size in one click.


On Windows, if your display scaling (for example, 175%) is set above 100%, screenshots are captured at a larger size and look incorrect when pasted into Figma. This plugin helps you downscale screenshots so they appear correctly in Figma.


To use the plugin properly, set the same scale value in the plugin settings as in your Windows display settings.

plugins.name: MoroccanMock
plugins.description:
Design layouts more efficiently by pulling text strings, images, and cultural assets from a unique Moroccan-inspired palette. "moroccanMock" lets you create custom Moroccan-themed content and share it with other Figma users. Collaboration has never been easier!


Content:

Browse or search content to find a collection of Moroccan-inspired text strings, images, and icons. Struggling to find the perfect content? You can create your own text and image assets by using Add.


Add:

Create text categories and populate them with your own text strings. You can also upload up to 20 PNGs or JPEGs to create image content. As a creator, you may choose to share it publicly or keep it private. When you create content, it is automatically pinned to the Home Screen for quick access (signed-in users only).


Customize Your Home Screen:

Optimize your workflow by pinning the content that you use most to your home screen. Apply 1-click access to any content type with the switch of a toggle (signed-in users only). Drag and drop items on your home screen to suit your preferences.


How to use moroccanMock:

Find content:

Access saved content from your Home Screen or navigate through the tabs to search or browse content. Pin it for ease of access to your home screen.


Applying text content:

Select one or more text layers in your design to apply strings individually or apply them all. Use the original order provided or choose an order from the drop-down menu.


Applying image content:

Select one or more image layers or frames in your design, then apply the images individually or apply them all in random order.


Applying icon content:

Browse the collection or use the search bar to find a Moroccan icon. Click on the icon or drag and drop it into your design. You can also adjust the icon size to scale as needed.


Creating text and image content:

Navigate to the Add tab, click Add, and select content type. Provide a Title relevant to your content. Set your content to Public or Private. See the terms and conditions regarding usage and rights.


Anwar Bahou

LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/bahouanwar
plugins.tagline: Bring Moroccan Culture to Your Designs – Instantly

plugins.name: GridVar | Quick Column Grid with Variables
plugins.description:
GridVar helps you create width-based column layout grids with linked variables for any frame width. It automatically generates a set of variables representing different column configurations, including gutters, so you can quickly adjust and find the perfect fit for nested layers.


✨ Key Features:

•Quick Setup: Easily create layout grids with variable-based configurations.

•Flexible Widths: Effortlessly switch between column setups to match your design needs.

•Time-Saving: Eliminate manual calculations and streamline your workflow.


📌 How It Works:

Generated variables are conveniently stored in the "GridVar" variable collection. You can find the column width variables under: [Grid Name]/Columns.


Perfect for designers looking to simplify layout grid handling and enhance their Figma workflow.
plugins.tagline: GridVar: Width-based Layout Grids with Variables

plugins.name: Draft Alpha
plugins.description:
DraftAlpha – Figma Plugin

Deliver consistent UX content aligned with your brand guidelines


DraftAlpha enables you to effortlessly create, collaborate, and maintain brand-consistent UX content directly within Figma.


Key Features:


✅ AI-powered Brand Guidelines Builder

- Instantly generate tailored brand guidelines, including writing rules, tone of voice, target audience, and brand pillars.

- Customize guidelines precisely to reflect your brand identity.


✅ Content Consistency & Compliance

- Automatically check content for adherence to your established brand guidelines.

- Generate multiple content variants aligned with your brand.


✅ Centralized Content & Collaboration

- Single source of truth for all UX copy and team collaboration.

- Approval workflows, user roles, and content status management.

- Build reusable content components with localization support.


✅ Seamless Localization

- Quickly generate brand-consistent localized content in 20+ languages.

- Manage and apply localization variants directly in Figma.


✅ Integrated Figma Workflow

- Access your content library and apply content to designs instantly.

- Real-time brand guideline compliance checking within your design files.

- Effortlessly preview designs across multiple language variants.
plugins.tagline: Deliver UX Content consistent with brand guidelines

plugins.name: Amplifi for Figma
plugins.description:
Quickly assess how intelligible and understandable your text is from directly within the Figma app. The Amplifi Intelligibility Score is our proprietary score that combines a wide range of intelligibility metrics. The score takes into consideration what words actually mean and considers how difficult those concepts are to understand. This creates a true assessment of intelligibility risk.


Key features:

  1. Instantly assess intelligibility for content frames and text nodes.
  2. See a detailed breakdown of what is causing complexity within the text.
  3. See the improvement in scoring after making edits and changes to the text.

plugins.name: Page Assistant
plugins.description:
A 🗂️ Page Assistant to help you quickly set up your files and pages structure the way you want them; on new or existing files. No more need for duplicating template files.


§ Sections

Automatically apply your desired file sections with dividers on existing or new files.


⚙️ Customizable

Customize these sections name and order to your specific needs, and save your preferences for future use.


✏️ Page names

Batch-apply a page name prefix and/or suffix to all non-section pages.


This is a work in progress. All feedback is welcome!

plugins.name: TokenBoard
plugins.description:
TokenBoard is an advanced Figma plugin designed to give you full visibility and control over local variable collections — whether you’re building a robust design system, managing light/dark modes, or maintaining consistent styles across teams.


Features Overview


Explore Variables by Collection, Scope & Mode

  1. Browse all local variable collections in your Figma file
  2. Organized as expandable tree structures by collection, group, and nested groups
  3. View and compare values across all modes (e.g. “Light”, “Dark”)


Smart Search

  1. Instant full-text search across variable names, values, types, and scopes
  2. Highlights matches inside nested groups
  3. Keeps scroll position and selection while typing


Visual & Semantic Display

  1. Color tokens show live swatches, hex values, and opacity
  2. Boolean, number, string tokens are clearly labeled
  3. Aliases display as links to target variables with inline previews


Aliases & References

  1. Displays alias chains with resolved values
  2. Clickable interface to explore alias references
  3. Supports setting or detaching aliases via selector popup


Inline Editing of Values

  1. Edit most values directly inside the table: Colors (rgba), Strings, Numbers, Booleans, Aliases
  2. Shows validation states and editable highlights
  3. Supports editing multiple modes in a variable


Selection-Aware Variable Inspector

  1. Automatically detects all variables applied to the selected node(s) on the canvas
  2. Displays them grouped by collection, scope, and mode
  3. Resolves and highlights any aliases used
  4. Handles nested selections and multiple nodes
  5. Edit Values Directly from the Selection
  6. Selection-based variable data is cached with a unique key
  7. Improves performance when switching between nodes
  8. Cache is auto-expired after 5 minutes or can be manually refreshed


Batch Update

  1. Send a list of changes (e.g. 30+ variable updates) in one click
  2. Type conversion (color objects, strings, aliases)
  3. Font loading for FONT_FAMILY variables (with fallback to alternative styles if “Regular” not available)
  4. Scope checks and error recovery per variable
  5. Returns a report of successful and failed updates


Performance Optimizations

  1. In-memory caching of selection data with expiry (5 min)
  2. Caches up to 50 different selections to reduce API calls
  3. Tracks which variables are already loaded to avoid duplication


Figma API Compatibility Handling

  1. Graceful fallback if variable APIs or methods are unavailable
  2. Error messages guide user to fix or retry


Clean, Resizable UI

  1. Fully styled native-like UI with Figma theme support (light/dark)
  2. Flexible layout with resizable panel
  3. Displays progress during data load
  4. Empty states and error messages styled for clarity


Ideal Use Cases

  1. Design system audits
  2. Token cleanup and maintenance
  3. Visual QA of theme modes
  4. Alias linking and optimization
  5. Batch updates to variable values
  6. Color or typography token management


Compatibility

  1. Built for the latest Figma API with full variable support
  2. Works in Figma files only (not FigJam)
  3. Requires Variables feature enabled in your Figma workspace

accepted.name: Andrei Kuznetsov
accepted.description: Templates, UI Kits, Design Systems, Plugins

plugins.tagline: Advanced Figma plugin for browsing, editing, and batch-managing local variables, modes, and aliases

plugins.name: RouteMyPath
plugins.description:
RouteMyPath is a Figma plugin designed for runners, designers, and creators who want to bring their workout journeys into their visual work.


Upload a .gpx file from your running app (e.g., Strava, Garmin, etc.) and RouteMyPath will:

•Parse your route data

•Visualize it as editable vector paths

•Enable custom layout and styling in Figma


Ideal for designing performance recaps, social sharing visuals, or creating unique journey-based content right inside your Figma canvas.
plugins.tagline: A Figma plugin that turns your GPX route data into editable design elements
